hints.content: Start by understanding the input format. You will be given an array of integers representing the weights of apples. Each integer corresponds to the weight of a single apple.
Think about what it means to 'put apples into the basket'. Consider whether there are any constraints on the total weight that the basket can hold. This will guide how you approach the problem.
Consider the possibility of sorting the array of apple weights. Sorting can help you easily determine which apples to select first based on their weights.
What happens if the basket has a maximum weight limit? Ensure that your solution accounts for this limit while selecting apples.
As you iterate through the sorted list of apples, keep a running total of the weights. This will help you track how many apples you can add without exceeding the basket's capacity.
Think about edge cases, such as when the input array is empty or when all apples are too heavy to fit in the basket. How will you handle these scenarios?
If the basket can hold a weight equal to the sum of all apples, you should be able to add all of them. Consider how you would check this condition.
Make sure to keep track of the number of apples you are adding to the basket. You will need to return this count as part of your solution.
Consider using a loop to go through the sorted apple weights. You can use a counter to keep track of how many apples you have added to the basket so far.
Finally, ensure your solution returns the correct format. You should return the total count of apples that can fit into the basket. Think about how you will structure your return statement.

questionNotes: Input: An array of integers representing apple weights.
Output: An integer representing the count of apples that can fit in the basket.
Consider edge cases such as an empty array or all weights exceeding the basket's limit.
The basket's weight limit should be defined, but is not explicitly mentioned in the problem statement.
